qas.question: Who invaded the countries of Lithuania, Estonia and Latvia?
What region of Lithuania was to be turned over to the Nazis?
Of the three countries invaded, which lost the least amount of people through deportation or loss of life?
How did these countries become part of the USSR?

answers.text: Elections were held with single pro-Soviet candidates

qas.question: Who left the countries of Lithuania, Estonia and Latvia?
What region of Lithuania wasn't to be turned over to the Nazis?
What region of Lithuania was to be turned over to the French?
Of the three countries invaded, which lost the most amount of people through deportation or loss of life?

plausible_answers.text: Elections were held with single pro-Soviet candidates listed for many positions

qas.question: How didn't these countries become part of the USSR?

context: In mid-June 1940, when international attention was focused on the German invasion of France, <a0_0><b4_0>Soviet NKVD<b4_0/><a0_0/> troops raided border posts in Lithuania, Estonia and <a2_0><b7_0>Latvia<b7_0/><a2_0/>. State administrations were liquidated and replaced by Soviet cadres, in which 34,250 Latvians, 75,000 Lithuanians and almost 60,000 Estonians were deported or killed. <a3_0><b8_0>Elections were held with single pro-Soviet candidates<a3_0/> listed for many positions<b8_0/>, with resulting peoples assemblies immediately requesting admission into the USSR, which was granted by the Soviet Union. The USSR annexed the whole of Lithuania, including the <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Scheschupe area<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>, which was to be given to Germany.
